H.name: Hydrogen
H.info: Lightest gas. Used in rockets and fuel cells.

B.name: Boron
B.info: Used in glass and cleaning products.

C.name: Carbon
C.info: Basis of life, found in diamonds and graphite.

N.name: Nitrogen
N.info: Makes up most of Earth's air.

F.name: Fluorine
F.info: Highly reactive element used in toothpaste.

Na.name: Sodium
Na.info: Reactive metal part of table salt.

Al.name: Aluminium
Al.info: Light metal used in cans and aircraft.

Si.name: Silicon
Si.info: Used in glass and computer chips.

Ar.name: Argon
Ar.info: Inert gas used in bulbs and welding.

K.name: Potassium
K.info: Important nutrient for plants and cells.

Cr.name: Chromium
Cr.info: Shiny metal used in stainless steel.

Fe.name: Iron
Fe.info: Main metal in construction and blood hemoglobin.

Co.name: Cobalt
Co.info: Used in batteries and blue pigments.

Ni.name: Nickel
Ni.info: Used in coins and stainless alloys.

Zn.name: Zinc
Zn.info: Used to protect steel from rust.

Ga.name: Gallium
Ga.info: Melts in hand, used in electronics.

As.name: Arsenic
As.info: Toxic element historically used in poisons.

Se.name: Selenium
Se.info: Used in photocopiers and health supplements.

Br.name: Bromine
Br.info: Liquid element used in flame retardants.

Rb.name: Rubidium
Rb.info: Soft metal used in research and electronics.

Sr.name: Strontium
Sr.info: Used in fireworks for red color.

Y.name: Yttrium
Y.info: Used in LEDs and medical lasers.

Tc.name: Technetium
Tc.info: Radioactive metal used in medical scans.

Rh.name: Rhodium
Rh.info: Highly valuable metal used in catalytic converters.

Pd.name: Palladium
Pd.info: Used in jewelry and fuel cells.

Ag.name: Silver
Ag.info: Used in jewelry and best electrical conductor.

Sb.name: Antimony
Sb.info: Used in flame retardants and alloys.

Te.name: Tellurium
Te.info: Used in solar panels and alloys.

I.name: Iodine
I.info: Used in medicine and thyroid health.

Xe.name: Xenon
Xe.info: Used in bright headlights and lasers.

Cs.name: Cesium
Cs.info: Used in atomic clocks and drilling fluids.

Ba.name: Barium
Ba.info: Used in X-ray imaging and fireworks.

La.name: Lanthanum
La.info: Used in camera lenses and hybrid batteries.

Ce.name: Cerium
Ce.info: Used in polishing glass and catalytic converters.

Nd.name: Neodymium
Nd.info: Used in strong magnets and headphones.

Pm.name: Promethium
Pm.info: Rare radioactive element used in research.

Eu.name: Europium
Eu.info: Used in TV screens and fluorescent lights.

Tb.name: Terbium
Tb.info: Used in green phone screen phosphors.

Yb.name: Ytterbium
Yb.info: Used in sensors and alloy strengthening.

W.name: Tungsten
W.info: Very dense metal used in bulbs and armor.

Os.name: Osmium
Os.info: Very dense metal used in pens and alloys.

Pt.name: Platinum
Pt.info: Used in jewelry and catalytic converters.

Au.name: Gold
Au.info: Valuable metal used in jewelry and electronics.

Pb.name: Lead
Pb.info: Heavy toxic metal once in pipes and paint.

Po.name: Polonium
Po.info: Highly radioactive element used in research.

Fr.name: Francium
Fr.info: Extremely rare and highly radioactive metal.

Ra.name: Radium
Ra.info: Glows in dark; used historically in paints (radioactive).

Ac.name: Actinium
Ac.info: Radioactive metal used in cancer treatment research.

Th.name: Thorium
Th.info: Radioactive metal considered for future reactors.

Pa.name: Protactinium
Pa.info: Rare radioactive element used in research only.

U.name: Uranium
U.info: Used as nuclear fuel in power plants.

Np.name: Neptunium
Np.info: Radioactive metal used in neutron detectors.

Pu.name: Plutonium
Pu.info: Used in nuclear reactors and weapons.

Cm.name: Curium
Cm.info: Radioactive metal used for space power sources.

Bk.name: Berkelium
Bk.info: Synthetic metal used only for research.

Cf.name: Californium
Cf.info: Used in neutron radiation and mining exploration.

Es.name: Einsteinium
Es.info: Extremely rare synthetic element for research.

Fm.name: Fermium
Fm.info: Radioactive synthetic element discovered in bomb tests.

Md.name: Mendelevium
Md.info: Synthetic element named after periodic table creator.

No.name: Nobelium
No.info: Synthetic radioactive element used in research.

Lr.name: Lawrencium
Lr.info: Man-made radioactive element with short lifespan.

Rf.name: Rutherfordium
Rf.info: Synthetic element named after Ernest Rutherford.

Sg.name: Seaborgium
Sg.info: Synthetic element named after Glenn Seaborg.

Bh.name: Bohrium
Bh.info: Radioactive synthetic metal named after Niels Bohr.

Hs.name: Hassium
Hs.info: Synthetic element with very short life.

Mt.name: Meitnerium
Mt.info: Synthetic element named after Lise Meitner.

Ds.name: Darmstadtium
Ds.info: Very unstable element discovered in Germany.

Rg.name: Roentgenium
Rg.info: Named after X-ray discoverer Wilhelm RÃ¶ntgen.

Cn.name: Copernicium
Cn.info: Named after astronomer Copernicus, highly unstable.

Mc.name: Moscovium
Mc.info: Named after Moscow region where discovered.

Ts.name: Tennessine
Ts.info: Halogen-like synthetic element named after Tennessee.

Og.name: Oganesson
Og.info: Heaviest known element with unpredictable behavior.
